verses.text: O Lord, rebuke me not in your wrath, neither chasten me in your anger.
Pity me, O Lord; for I am weak: heal me, O Lord; for my bones are vexed.
My soul also is grievously vexed: but you, O Lord, how long?
Return, O Lord, deliver my soul: save me for your mercy's sake.
For in death no man remembers you: and who will give you thanks in Hades?
\f + \fr 6:6 \fl Gr. \ft I have laboured. \f* I am wearied with my groaning; I shall wash my bed every night; I shall water my couch with tears.
My eye is troubled because of my wrath; I am worn out because of all my enemies.
Depart from me, all youâŒƒ that work iniquity; for the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping.
The Lord has listened to my petition; the Lord has accepted my prayer.
Let all my enemies be put to shame and sore troubled: let them be turned back and grievously put to shame speedily.
